summary: The Independent Acting IGs Act of 2025 amends Title 5 of the United States Code to change the process for appointing acting Inspectors General (IGs) when a vacancy occurs. It mandates that a judge from the relevant court of appeals, chosen randomly, appoint the acting IG, drawing from a list of candidates recommended by a committee of Inspectors General. The bill also clarifies timelines for these appointments and addresses which individuals can fill the acting IG role, aiming to ensure continuity in IG functions.
